title: Noor Benny
text:
As a UCLA Statistics and Data Science student, I’m deeply passionate about the intersection of data and marketing. With a solid foundation in analytics and a penchant for creative problem-solving, I thrive in deciphering data insights to drive strategic decision-making.
My journey is fueled by curiosity and a relentless drive to explore new avenues in data science and marketing. From analyzing market trends to harnessing the power of digital platforms, I’m committed to pushing the boundaries of what’s possible with data.
Join me as I navigate the ever-evolving landscape of data-driven innovation!
You can find my current resume attached here.

text:

Additionally, I provide support with photocopying, data entry, and distributing and picking up materials. I interact with staff and students at all levels of the organization and various campus departments, while maintaining confidentiality.

Facilitated confidential client interactions, ensuring satisfaction while scheduling multi-day events
Managed contract processing through UCLA Events Online (EOL), confirming venue reservations and adhering to company policies.
Spearheaded accurate data entry into Salesforce, collaborating with staff, students, and clients of all levels.

title: Work Experience
text:
Data-Driven Brand Marketing Intern
Orenda Marketing | Jun 2023 - Aug 2023 | Los Angeles, California, United States
I was responsible for assisting in conducting market research to stay on top of trends and best practices. I provide analytics support for client accounts and agency marketing efforts. Additionally, I conduct competitive analysis and report on findings, helping inform strategic decision-making. My role also involves developing and maintaining client reports, ensuring accurate and actionable information is delivered. Collaborating with the co-founders, I actively contribute to the development and refinement of the data-driven agency strategy. With my statistics and data science background, I play a key role in keeping the agency ahead of the curve with emerging marketing trends. Alongside these core responsibilities, I am always ready to assist with general administrative tasks and take on additional duties as needed.
Accomplishments:

Conducted comprehensive market research on rival companies, providing valuable insights for strategic planning and decision-making.
Developed and delivered weekly presentation decks, effectively communicating complex data and findings to stakeholders.
Analyzed data across various marketing platforms, notably Google Analytics, contributing to the creation of impactful case studies published on the company website.
Attained Google Analytics certification, enhancing proficiency in data analytics and contributing expertise to the marketing team’s efforts.

title: Work Experience
text:
Digital Marketing Intern
Meta | Jun 2022 - Sep 2022 | Monterey, California
I partnered with a small businesses in an underserved community in a fellowship in Digital Marketing. I learned from Meta educational, online courses and took the Meta certification exam for a Digital Marketing Associate to qualify my skillset. During the 12-week summer Fellowship, a I received mentorship from a Meta employee, ongoing training, and tech support to help me succeed on the job.
Accomplishments:

Enhanced online visibility and impact for small businesses post-training with Meta employees through comprehensive online courses.
Achieved a notable increase in business’s Instagram metrics: amplified follower engagement by 38%, expanded reach by 9.5%, and boosted total followers by 14.5%.
Provided consistent updates to employers through detailed visual presentations in weekly progress reports.
Compiled a comprehensive multi-page document detailing future strategies for sustained digital marketing efforts, benefiting the company’s continued presence and growth on digital platforms.

title: About
text:
I’m Noor Benny, a California native with a passion for delving into data and exploring the great outdoors. Growing up on the Monterey Peninsula, I developed a deep appreciation for nature and all its wonders. Whether it’s hiking through the rugged trails or soaking in the tranquility of the beach, you’ll often find me embracing the beauty of Northern California’s landscapes.
Currently, I’m pursuing my studies in statistics and data science at UCLA, where I’m honing my analytical skills and delving into the fascinating world of data. My ultimate goal is to carve out a career path as a data analyst in the dynamic fields of media and marketing. I’m driven by the prospect of leveraging data-driven insights to optimize strategies and unlock new opportunities in the ever-evolving landscape of digital media.
What sets me apart is my diverse skill set, cultivated through hands-on experience in marketing gained from past internships and professional endeavors. I thrive on the challenge of analyzing complex datasets and translating them into actionable insights that drive growth and innovation.
Through this journey, I’m dedicated to continuous learning and growth, always seeking new avenues to expand my knowledge and make meaningful contributions to the world around me.

title: Projects
text:
Under UCLA’s Department of Statistics and Data Science, our team explored the correlation between IMDb movie reviews and sentiments. Using a dataset of 50,000 reviews, we aimed to predict sentiments (negative/positive) from textual content employing logistic regression, KNN, LDA, QDA, and random forests.
Key Highlights:

Data Preprocessing: Cleaned and processed 50,000 reviews using Python, refining text content for analysis.
Descriptive Statistics & Visualization: Balanced dataset with equal positive/negative sentiments. Word cloud analysis emphasized emotionally loaded words’ significance.
Feature Engineering: Constructed a 110-feature set using TF-IDF, sentiment lexicons, and word frequencies.
Dimensionality Reduction: Employed PCA to reduce high-dimensional text data while retaining crucial information.
Model Evaluation: Logistic regression achieved 78.51% accuracy and 0.86 AUC. Random forests outperformed with an 84% accuracy, excelling in capturing complex patterns.
Insights & Recommendations: Highlighted model performances, strengths, and limitations. Proposed future research on user-specific features and advanced dimensionality reduction for enhanced accuracy.

Our project not only provided valuable insights into sentiment analysis but also highlighted the effectiveness of various classification methods in predicting sentiments from textual data. This endeavor expanded our understanding of statistical modeling in the realm of sentiment analysis for movie reviews on IMDb.
See project here.

title: Projects
section: Examining Voter Turnout Rates in Congressional Elections
text:
Examining Voter Turnout Rates in Congressional Elections
The purpose of this project is to examine the distribution of voter turnout rates in Congressional Elections of the population of different age groups and the distribution of voter turnout rates of different races. Using the data of voter turnout rates in Congressional Elections from 1966 to 2018, my group and I developed a linear regression model on the growth and decay of voter turnout rates of various age groups and races through curve fitting. In this project, we provide an insight on how to resolve the lower voter turnout rates in Congressional Elections for young people and racial minority groups. We propose methods to increase the voter turnout rates in the younger population and racial minority groups.
See project here.

title: Projects
text:
Annual Duck Race Fest | ASCA
I partnered with a teammate to engineer a 18” inflated duck with no limitations in the choice of propulsion and steering technologies. We designed and constructed working prototypes and worked within a budget to produce a final result. Our team won third place in a final race against fifteen teams from local colleges.
See project here.

title: Projects
section: Getting to Philosophy: Data Sturctures in Java
text:
Getting to Philosophy: Data Sturctures in Java
In the project, I worked with source code on Wikipedia pages to automate the process that accompanies the “Wikipedia: Getting to Philosophy” phenomenon. The phenomenon states that clicking on the first link in the main text of an English Wikipedia article, and repeating the process for subsequent articles, leads to the Philosophy article 97% of the time. In order to accomplish this, the algorithm should (1) click on the first non-parenthesized, non-italicized link, (2) ignore external links, links to the current page, or links to non-existent pages, and (3) stop when reaching the Philosophy article, a page with no links, a page that does not exist, or when a loop occurs. This project required knowledge of data structures and some familiarity with HTML.
See project here.
